page.title: 01Keynsham.
page.content: Keynsham is situated between Bristol and Bath. It is south of the junction of the River Avon and River Chew. Keynsham is very old. It is mentioned in the Domesday Book and in 1085 its name was spelt Cainesham. The population of Keynsham is 20,443. The most important building in Keynsham is the Cadbury's factory (Somerdale). It is the largest building in Keynsham and many people work there. The High Street is very busy. Keynsham also has a park with a golf course, a bowling green and tennis courts. The Leisure Centre has a swimming pool and sports facilities. North of the River Avon lies Willsbridge and The Old Railway Path.
